Uses of Class
net.pocorall.automaton.DefaultAutomaton

    • Uses of DefaultAutomaton in net.pocorall.automaton

      Methods in net.pocorall.automaton that return DefaultAutomaton 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.clone()
      Returns a clone of this automaton.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.complement()
      See BasicOperations.complement(DefaultAutomaton).
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.complement(DefaultAutomaton a)
      Returns a (deterministic) automaton that accepts the complement of the language of the given automaton.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.compress(DefaultAutomaton a, String set, char c)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the compressed language of the given automaton.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.concatenate(DefaultAutomaton a)
      See BasicOperations.concatenate(DefaultAutomaton, DefaultAutomaton).
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.concatenate(DefaultAutomaton a1, DefaultAutomaton a2)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the concatenation of the languages of the given automata.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.concatenate(List<DefaultAutomaton> l)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the concatenation of the languages of the given automata.
      static DefaultAutomaton Datatypes.get(String name)
      Returns pre-built automaton.
      DefaultAutomaton DatatypesAutomatonProvider.getAutomaton(String name) 
      DefaultAutomaton AutomatonProvider.getAutomaton(String name)
      Returns automaton of the given name.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.hexCases(DefaultAutomaton a)
      Constructs automaton that accepts the same strings as the given automaton but ignores upper/lower case of A-F.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.homomorph(DefaultAutomaton a, char[] source, char[] dest)
      Returns an automaton accepting the homomorphic image of the given automaton using the given function.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.intersection(DefaultAutomaton a)
      See BasicOperations.intersection(DefaultAutomaton, DefaultAutomaton).
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.intersection(DefaultAutomaton a1, DefaultAutomaton a2)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the intersection of the languages of the given automata.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeAnyChar()
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton that accepts any single character.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeAnyString()
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton that accepts all strings.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeChar(char c)
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton that accepts a single character of the given value.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeCharRange(char min, char max)
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton that accepts a single char whose value is in the given interval (including both end points).
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeCharSet(String set)
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton that accepts a single character in the given set.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeDecimalValue(String value)
      Constructs automaton that accept strings representing the given decimal number.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeEmpty()
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton with the empty language.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeEmptyString()
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton that accepts only the empty string.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeFractionDigits(int i)
      Constructs automaton that accept strings representing decimal numbers that can be written with at most the given number of digits in the fraction part.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeIntegerValue(String value)
      Constructs automaton that accept strings representing the given integer.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeInterval(int min, int max, int digits)
      Returns a new automaton that accepts strings representing decimal non-negative integers in the given interval.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeMaxInteger(String n)
      Constructs automaton that accept strings representing nonnegative integers that are not larger than the given value.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeMinInteger(String n)
      Constructs automaton that accept strings representing nonnegative integers that are not less that the given value.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeString(String s)
      Returns a new (deterministic) automaton that accepts the single given string.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeStringMatcher(String s)
      Constructs deterministic automaton that matches strings that contain the given substring.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeStringUnion(CharSequence... strings)
      Returns a new (deterministic and minimal) automaton that accepts the union of the given set of strings.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicAutomataFactory.makeTotalDigits(int i)
      Constructs automaton that accept strings representing decimal numbers that can be written with at most the given number of digits.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.minimize()
      Minimizes (and determinizes if not already deterministic) the given automaton.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.minus(DefaultAutomaton a)
      See BasicOperations.minus(DefaultAutomaton, DefaultAutomaton).
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.minus(DefaultAutomaton a1, DefaultAutomaton a2)
      Returns a (deterministic) automaton that accepts the intersection of the language of a1 and the complement of the language of a2.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.optional()
      Returns an automaton that accepts the union of the empty string and the language of the given automaton.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.overlap(DefaultAutomaton a1, DefaultAutomaton a2)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the overlap of strings that in more than one way can be split into a left part being accepted by a1 and a right part being accepted by a2.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.projectChars(DefaultAutomaton a, Set<Character> chars)
      Returns an automaton with projected alphabet.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.repeat()
      See BasicOperations.repeat(DefaultAutomaton).
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.repeat(DefaultAutomaton a)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the Kleene star (zero or more concatenated repetitions) of the language of the given automaton.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.repeat(DefaultAutomaton a, int min)
      Returns an automaton that accepts min or more concatenated repetitions of the language of the given automaton.
      static DefaultAutomaton BasicOperations.repeat(DefaultAutomaton a, int min, int max)
      Returns an automaton that accepts between min and max (including both) concatenated repetitions of the language of the given automaton.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.repeat(int min)
      See BasicOperations.repeat(DefaultAutomaton, int).
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.repeat(int min, int max)
      See BasicOperations.repeat(DefaultAutomaton, int, int).
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.replaceWhitespace(DefaultAutomaton a)
      Constructs automaton that accepts 0x20, 0x9, 0xa, and 0xd in place of each 0x20 transition in the given automaton.
      static DefaultAutomaton ShuffleOperations.shuffle(DefaultAutomaton a1, DefaultAutomaton a2)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the shuffle (interleaving) of the languages of the given automata.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.singleChars(DefaultAutomaton a)
      Returns an automaton that accepts the single chars that occur in strings that are accepted by the given automaton.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.subst(DefaultAutomaton a, char c, String s)
      Returns an automaton where all transitions of the given char are replaced by a string.
      static DefaultAutomaton SpecialOperations.subst(DefaultAutomaton a, Map<Character,Set<Character>> map)
      Returns an automaton where all transition labels have been substituted.
      DefaultAutomaton DefaultAutomaton.subst(Map<Character,Set<Character>> map)
      See SpecialOperations.subst(DefaultAutomaton, Map).

      Returns the longest string that is a prefix of all accepted strings and visits each state at most once.

      Returns the set of accepted strings, assuming this automaton has a finite language.

      Returns the set of accepted strings, assuming that at most limit strings are accepted.

      Returns a shortest accepted/rejected string.
